Posts.Content: phoenix54 wrote: HI everyone for those following my breast and uterine saga of continual tests and surgery over the past 7 months i am very happy to report that there is NO cancer present in either area. The hysterectomy pathology report showed atypia and polyps grown since the January D & C but no cancer present and no need for follow up other than a pap test each year for a bit til that is fine and then can skip it, re the breast tests - no need to go back til October for a follow up bilateral U/S - i feel like i just picked up the "get out of jail free" card. tomorrow i go to see the onc and get the prescription for Arimidex. i am recovering nicely from the hysterectomy and seems like peace will reign in my life for a bit. off to a job interview tomorrow so can go with my mind at rest hugs to you all and thanks so much for your kind words of support Barbara Dx 8/7/2005, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/11 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: finally - very good news phoenix54 phoenix54

Posts.Content: phoenix54 wrote: HI I am going to have the a complete hysterectomy in 2 weeks - everything out so can start Arimedex. Luckily it will be done laparscopically (SP?). Was wondering about your experience were afterwards? How long did it take you to recover? What types of menopause symptoms have you experienced How long does it take to go away? thanks Barb Dx 8/7/2005, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/11 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: May 7, 2008 06:22AM phoenix54 wrote: HI Dani My surgery is scheduled for May 15 - next Thursday. we should compare notes and recovery issues - let's keep in touch. i am on the West Coast in Vancouver, BC on the other side of the country. i had invasive BC - and can't take tamoxifen so onto the AI's - not sure how long will know more at the end of May when i go back to the onc after the surgery. all the best to you! i am off to bone density testing, cholesterol testing and chest Xrays for pre op surgery appts. any plans for handling the boredom of recovery... Barb

Posts.Content: Dec 2, 2007 10:25PM phoenix54 wrote: i feel like i am losing my mind over all this. i alternate between feeling this is not happening to me .... to feeling like i can't go on one more minute with not knowing. and scared...... and trying not to cry.... or panic..... ativan again...... ??? i have a big week at work ahead and don't know how i can go on normally and do my job... it is all overwhelming..... i hope once i get there and get going i will be able to focus and do it. i facilitate groups and it is day 1 of a 2 week program.... yikes!
Posts.Title: Tips for handling stress while waiting for test results phoenix54 phoenix54

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2007 06:41PM phoenix54 wrote: i got my results this afternoon - one week of waiting - good for BC health care system and it is B9 - no cancer found. now just for the D & C and i can move on - YIPPEE!!!! good luck to everyone still waiting for results and praying for B9 results for you too Barb
Posts.Title: Tips for handling stress while waiting for test results phoenix54 phoenix54

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2007 09:38AM phoenix54 wrote: I was awake again last nite and popped back the ativan under the tongue. it still took an hour to work but then i slept like a baby and feel much better this morning. hmmm why do we say slept like a baby - as all the babies i know never slept well... :) hugs to all of us waiting - its been 5 days so far and i guess another week to go. i hope i hear by this Friday...... debbie - i think you are dissociating - where you are outside your body looking in and it all feels surreal. i keep wondering if they made a mistake.... is that denial???
Posts.Title: Tips for handling stress while waiting for test results phoenix54 phoenix54

Posts.Content: phoenix54 wrote: HI everyone i thought this might be a good thread. I have been struggling with waking in the middle of the night and can't get back to sleep. the brain gets going and i am done. or.... i wake in the morning and find i am in a panic until i can get a hold of myself, breathe, get up and calm myself. finally went to the doctor today and got a script for Ativan sublinguals. i am going to take one at bedtime tonight and hope i sleep. i feel its extra hard to cope when i am over tired any other suggestions on managing the stress of waiting for test results..... wishing you all B9 results Barb Dx 8/7/2005, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/11 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Tips for handling stress while waiting for test results phoenix54 phoenix54

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2008 07:19AM phoenix54 wrote: my drains were called turkey basters. (had the surgery around thanksgiving!) i had path reports that took ages. turns out they were waiting for special stains ordered to do some final checking. it took almost 3 long, long weeks. i was SURE it was bad news. turns out it was B9. i was trying to be thankful they were being so careful but it was a hard mind set to get to. waiting for test results is the hardest part - sending you hugs and keep us posted Barb
Posts.Title: Eviction jadatemple crazydaisy

Posts.Content: May 26, 2008 01:15PM phoenix54 wrote: i had no range of motion after my surgery and went for Physio with a woman who specializes in rehabbing cancer patients. it was like stretching a broken chicken wing - pardon the pun - but it did come back and is much better. I then worked out with a trainer for quite a few months to strengthen the area and it is better than ever. i am 2 - 1/2 years post surgery and it feels great now. i have a bit of numbness and lymphadema (which is under control) but otherwise all is fine. i am just recovering from a hysterectomy now and am so impatient to feel better. it has been 11 days and i am cranky and want to be back playing golf - soon! hang in there. i also remember taking tylenol 3 for a few months afterwards as it would get painful again and then subside. it WILL get better hugs
